In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
description: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.

Journalists in the West Bank face mounting suppression
description: Since October 7, Israel has arrested and imprisoned at least 140 journalists working in this occupied territory, most often under the catch-all charge of 'incitement to terrorism.' The Palestinian Journalists Syndicate has condemned what it describes as a strategy to 'silence' media professionals.

headline: Millions return home as Pacific tsunami warnings lifted
description: Storm surges of up to four meters (12 feet) were predicted for some parts of the Pacific, after the 8.8 quake struck off Russia's Kamchatka peninsula. The US Geological Survey said the quake was one of the 10 strongest tremors recorded since 1900. It was followed by dozens of aftershocks that further shook the Russian Far East

headline: Tour de France Femmes: Le Court makes history for Africa with fifth-stage victory
description: On Wednesday, Mauritian cyclist Kimberley Le Court-Pienaar won the sprint ahead of Dutch duo Demi Vollering and Anna van der Breggen. With this success, she has taken the leader's yellow jersey.

headline: 'I learned freedom at 34, and it was a revelation': Katja Lange-Müller, an eastern wind blows through West Berlin
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (3/6). Katja Lange-Müller, born in the German Democratic Republic (GDR), managed as an adult to cross 'to the other side' of the Wall, escaping her mother, a prominent member of the communist regime.

'In the West Berlin squats, we argued but lived together': Karin Wieland, political rebel
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (2/6). In the late 1970s, Karin Wieland fled her small German town to live communally in an abandoned building in Kreuzberg, throwing herself into every cause of the era.

headline: 'We often go to bed on empty stomachs': In Ethiopia's Afar region, hunger takes its toll
description: In northern Ethiopia, the freeze on USAID threatens to worsen food insecurity, already affecting thousands of families impacted by land drying up.

headline: Suing the state in France: How does this universal right work in practice?
description: Climate, health, femicides: Lawsuits against the state have surged in recent years. Beyond securing compensation for victims, these legal procedures primarily aim to raise public awareness and drive change.
